007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a right circular cone with its base
016   parallel to the xz-plane and its apex on the positive y-axis.
017<p>
018   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cone" target="_top">
019                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cone</a>
020<p>
021   This model can also be used to create right k-sided polygonal pyramids.
022<p>
023   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyramid_(geometry)" target="_top">
024                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyramid_(geometry)</a>
025
026   @see ConeFrustum
027*/
028public class Cone extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
029{
030   public final double r;
031   public final double h;
032   public final int n;
033   public final int k;
034   public final MeshType type;
035
036   /**
037      Create a right circular cone with its base in the xz-plane,
038      a base radius of 1, height 1, and apex on the positive y-axis.
039   */
040   public Cone( )
041   {
042      this(1, 1, 15, 16);
043   }
044
045
046   /**
047      Create a right circular cone with its base in the xz-plane,
048      a base radius of {@code r}, height {@code h}, and apex on
049      the y-axis.
050
051      @param r  radius of the base in the xz-plane
052      @param h  height of the apex on the y-axis
053   */
054   public Cone(final double r, final double h)
055   {
056      this(r, h, 15, 16);
057   }
058
059
060   /**
061      Create a right circular cone with its base in the xz-plane,
062      a base radius of {@code r}, height {@code h}, and apex on
063      the y-axis.
064   <p>
065      The last two parameters determine the number of lines of longitude
066      and the number of circles of latitude in the model.
067   <p>
068      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude in the model (including
069      the bottom edge), then each line of longitude will have {@code n+1}
070      line segments. If there are {@code k} lines of longitude, then each
071      circle of latitude will have {@code k} line segments.
072   <p>
073      There must be at least three lines of longitude and at least
074      one circle of latitude.
075   <p>
076      By setting {@code k} to be a small integer, this model can also
077      be used to create k-sided polygonal pyramids.
078
079      @param r  radius of the base in the xz-plane
080      @param h  height of the apex on the y-axis
081      @param n  number of circles of latitude around the cone
082      @param k  number of lines of longitude
083      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
084      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 4
085   */
086   public Cone(final double r, final double h,
087               final int n, final int k)
088   {
089      this(r, h, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
090   }
091
092
093   /**
094      Create a right circular cone with its base in the xz-plane,
095      a base radius of {@code r}, height {@code h}, and apex on
096      the y-axis.
097   <p>
098      The last two parameters determine the number of lines of longitude
099      and the number of circles of latitude in the model.
100   <p>
101      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude in the model (including
102      the bottom edge), then each line of longitude will have {@code n+1}
103      line segments. If there are {@code k} lines of longitude, then each
104      circle of latitude will have {@code k} line segments.
105   <p>
106      There must be at least three lines of longitude and at least
107      one circle of latitude.
108   <p>
109      By setting {@code k} to be a small integer, this model can also
110      be used to create k-sided polygonal pyramids.
111
112      @param r  radius of the base in the xz-plane
113      @param h  height of the apex on the y-axis
114      @param n  number of circles of latitude around the cone
115      @param k  number of lines of longitude
116      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
117      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
118      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 4
119   */
120   public Cone(final double r, final double h,
121               final int n, final int k,
122               final MeshType type)
123   {
124      super(String.format("Cone(%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)",
125                                r,   h,   n, k));
126
127      if (n < 2)
128         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 1");
129      if (k < 4)
130         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 3");
131
132      this.r = r;
133      this.h = h;
134      this.n = n;
135      this.k = k;
136      this.type = type;
137
138      // Create the cone's geometry.
139
140      final double deltaH = h / (n - 1),
141                   deltaTheta = (2.0 * Math.PI) / (k - 1);
142
143      // An array of vertices to be used to create triangles.
144      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][k];
145
146      // Create all the vertices.
147      for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose an angle of longitude
148      {
149         final double c = Math.cos(j * deltaTheta),
150                      s = Math.sin(j * deltaTheta);
151         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
152         {
153            final double slantRadius = r * (1 - i * deltaH / h);
154            v[i][j] = new Vertex(slantRadius * c,
155                                 i * deltaH,
156                                 slantRadius * s);
157         }
158      }
159      final Vertex apex = new Vertex(0, h, 0),
160           bottomCenter = new Vertex(0, 0, 0);
161
162      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
163      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
164      {
165         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
166         {
167            addVertex( v[i][j] );
168         }
169      }
170      addVertex(apex,
171                bottomCenter);
172      final int apexIndex = n * k,
173                bottomCenterIndex = apexIndex + 1;
174
175
176      // Create all the triangle strips along the cone wall.
177      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
178      {
179         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
180         {
181            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
182            for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
183            {
184               triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + j);  // v[i  ][j]
185               triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + j);  // v[i+1][j]
186            }
187            addPrimitive(triStrip);
188         }
189      }
190      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
191      {
192         for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
193         {
194            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
195            triStrip.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
196            for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
197            {
198               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j);    // v[i][j  ]
199               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
200            }
201            addPrimitive(triStrip);
202         }
203      }
204      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
205      {
206         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
207         {
208            for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
209            {
210               addPrimitive(
211                  new TriangleStrip(   i * k + j,       // v[i  ][j  ]
212                                    (1+i)* k + j,       // v[i+1][j  ]
213                                       i * k + j + 1,   // v[i  ][j+1]
214                                    (1+i)* k + j + 1)); // v[i+1][j+1]
215            }
216         }
217      }
218
219      if ( MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type
220        || MeshType.CHECKER == type )
221      {
222         // Create the triangle fan at the bottom.
223         final Primitive botFan = new TriangleFan();
224         botFan.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
225         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
226         {
227            botFan.addIndex( j );  // v[0][j]
228         }
229         addPrimitive(botFan);
230      }
231   }
232
233
234
235   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
236   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
237
238   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
239
240   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
241
242   @Override
243   public Cone remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
244   {
245      return new Cone(this.r, this.h,
246                      n, k,
247                      type);
248   }
249}//Cone
